item.title: Transfering state from server to client in a Blazor component
A primer on cement & concrete from the climate lens
item.description: This is the first post in a series about the cement & concrete industries and their place in the climate fight. It provides a general introduction to the subject, with some surprising facts I discovered along the way. This is a personal perspective and is subject to change based on feedback and further discussions. Feel free to reach out! I’ve been working for the past few months with Vicat (sidenote: For the anecdote, Louis Vicat is the inventor of one of the first modern cement formulations in 1817!

item.title: About
item.description: TL;DR I’m incredibly passionate about climate, computer science, food & wine, climbing, technology and science fiction. Pick any topic in there and I’m happy to talk hours about it! I’ve worked on data markets and blockchains, been a food photographer and am now focusing on writing code for the climate.

item.title: Now
item.description: I’m currently working with Vicat on how to get to net-zero emissions in the cement industry. With them, I’m building N-Zero, a modelling tool to create long term roadmaps towards net-zero CO2 emissions. While the project is private, I wrote a primer on the cement & concrete industries from a climate lens here. I recently caught the deep learning bug as well. Right now, I’m working on mini-dl, an educational deep learning framework built on top of JAX and simple-grad, an introduction going from zero to a complete auto-differentiation system, similar to what PyTorch or JAX use under the hood.
